text: It is possible that Harshavarman III was succeeded by a king named Nripatindravarman who reigned in Angkor until 1113 and that Jayavarman VI never reigned there. In fact Suryavarman II claimed to have seized power from two kings; one was his uncle Dharanindravarman I of which there is no inscription in Angkor; the other can only be Nripatindravarman.Coedès, 1986, p.153 ==Bibliography== * ==References== Category:11th-century Cambodian monarchs Category:Khmer Empire Category:Hindu monarchs Category:Cambodian Hindus Category:12th-century Cambodian monarchs
title: Nripatindravarman
